pull.title: net: Add missing locking annotation for vNodes. vNodes is guarded by cs_vNodes.
pull.body: Add locking annotation for `vNodes`. `vNodes` is guarded by `cs_vNodes`.

rename.from: net: Add missing cs_vNodes lock in CConnman::Stop(). Add missing locking annotation.
rename.to: net: Add missing cs_vNodes lock in CConnman::Stop(). Add missing locking annotation. [wip]

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

rename.from: net: Add missing cs_vNodes lock in CConnman::Stop(). Add missing locking annotation. [wip]
rename.to: net: Add missing locking annotation for vNodes. vNodes is guarded by cs_vNodes.

events.message: Add locking annotation for vNodes. vNodes is guarded by cs_vNodes.

events.body:
Thanks! I am still somewhat skeptical about adding a lock annotation then working around it, but all in all I think the annotation has value because it still allows checking the other uses of the lock. It's also good to document the hairy situation with a comment.

utACK eea02be70ee37b845f2719b3c08e5baf4b6f51f6

Adding the to-be-fixed data race for future reference:
